body: Hey @jackbentley, can you reproduce the issue on https://psalm.dev ?
No reproducer as no idea what's causing it ☝️

Let's check if we can rule out some possible causes:
* Does it happen when running with `--threads=1`?
* Does it happen when running with cache disabled (`--no-cache`)?

> it seems to be related to the functions/classes loaded in the autoloader defined.

I would also suggest to move those to composer autoloader, if possible. You can reference function files in [`autoload.files`](https://getcomposer.org/doc/04-schema.md#files) and classes in [`autoload.classmap`](https://getcomposer.org/doc/04-schema.md#classmap). Contrary to what some people believe the latter does not require adherence to any naming standard.

Thanks for the suggestions:

 - `--threads=1` - Same errors
 - `--no-cache` - Same errors
 - `--threads=1 --no-cache` - Same errors 

Interestingly, it must already be running with a single thread as it takes the same amount of time/memory.

As for the composer autoloader files/classmap - unfortunately, that's a bit too far out of my control. The codebase is huge and (very) old. We're slowing moving stuff over to namespaced classes. There are also hundreds of files more than what I need for psalm to work so wouldn't be quick to get done. I'll mention it to the teams responsible, though.

Worth noting that this isn't exclusive to `intval()` and `time()` and seems to appear on some other random functions:

```
ERROR: TooFewArguments - src/file/E.php:220:13 - Too few arguments for printMetadata - expecting 5 but saw 2 (see https://psalm.dev/025)
            array_merge(['uri' => $this->endpoint, 'trace' => 1], $this->proxySettings)

ERROR: TooFewArguments - src/file/F.php:151:20 - Too few arguments for newAdminLogin - expecting 2 but saw 1 (see https://psalm.dev/025)
        $localDB = getConnectionForSiteURL($siteURL);
```

It is consistent between runs in what is mismatched:
 - `intval` -> `updateUserPassword `
 - `time` -> `newUserFailedLogin`
 - `array_merge` -> `printMetadata`
 - `getConnectionForSiteURL` -> `newAdminLogin`
Can you reproduce in a separate repo?

I haven't been able to create a reproducer repo as of yet. Still trying.

However, a quick update with some interesting notes which might pique your interest:
 - When I don't include our project autoloader in psalm, it goes into an endless loop in the `Analyzing files...` stage. No progress bar gets shown. Can't reproduce this.
 - For some reason, files outside of the `<projectFiles>` directive are getting deep scanned.
    I did some code-diving and altered https://github.com/vimeo/psalm/blob/master/src/Psalm/Internal/Codebase/Scanner.php#L569-L573 to always shallow scan and it altered the results that I saw. There were still `TooFewArguments` errors but they were for completely different functions to before.
    I wasn't able to get a reproducer repo to deep scan files outside of the set scope. Is it normal for it to deep scan outside the set directories? I feel like this might have something to do with the error.

> Is it normal for it to deep scan outside the set directories?

It may. E.g. it does deep-scan files included during autoloader registration (see below). Doing this solved a lot of tricky issues, especially with polyfills.

https://github.com/vimeo/psalm/blob/0411049559f5e6043bb007684c89ce6667a4cadf/src/Psalm/Config.php#L1998-L2015

Still struggling to get a reproducer for this.

Working from the stack trace for the error, I was able to find out that `$cased_method_id` was changing from the passed in method id of `'time'` to `'newUserFailedLogin'` somewhere in these lines:
https://github.com/vimeo/psalm/blob/ea9cb72143b77e7520c52fa37290bd8d8bc88fd9/src/Psalm/Internal/Analyzer/Statements/Expression/Call/ArgumentsAnalyzer.php#L456-L487

The culprit turned out to be line 485 which changed the value from the same as `$method_id` to the one in the `$function_storage` which is passed in alongside `$method_id`. This means that, in this case, the `FunctionLikeStorage` class passed in is not for the correct function.

Working backwards from this, the method call gets it's `$function_storage` from a call to `$codebase_functions->getStorage()`
https://github.com/vimeo/psalm/blob/ea9cb72143b77e7520c52fa37290bd8d8bc88fd9/src/Psalm/Internal/Analyzer/Statements/Expression/Call/FunctionCallAnalyzer.php#L250

NB: Interestingly, in the master branch, this line has slightly changed since the version 4.2.1 that I'm using.

I worked out that `getStorage()` is returning a `FunctionLikeStorage` early from the `self::$stubbed_functions`
https://github.com/vimeo/psalm/blob/ea9cb72143b77e7520c52fa37290bd8d8bc88fd9/src/Psalm/Internal/Codebase/Functions.php#L76

Eventually, this led me to `addGlobalFunction`. At some point, this method is being called where `$function_id` doesn't match `$storage->cased_name`.
https://github.com/vimeo/psalm/blob/ea9cb72143b77e7520c52fa37290bd8d8bc88fd9/src/Psalm/Internal/Codebase/Functions.php#L146

Adding some debug code here gives the following output:

```php
        if (strtolower((string) $function_id) !== strtolower((string) $storage->cased_name)) {
            debug_print_backtrace(2);
        }
```

```
#0  Psalm\Internal\Codebase\Functions->addGlobalFunction() called at [/var/www/html/vendor/vimeo/psalm/src/Psalm/Internal/PhpVisitor/Reflector/FunctionLikeNodeScanner.php:652]
#1  Psalm\Internal\PhpVisitor\Reflector\FunctionLikeNodeScanner->start() called at [/var/www/html/vendor/vimeo/psalm/src/Psalm/Internal/PhpVisitor/ReflectorVisitor.php:233]
#2  Psalm\Internal\PhpVisitor\ReflectorVisitor->enterNode() called at [/var/www/html/vendor/nikic/php-parser/lib/PhpParser/NodeTraverser.php:200]
#3  PhpParser\NodeTraverser->traverseArray() called at [/var/www/html/vendor/nikic/php-parser/lib/PhpParser/NodeTraverser.php:91]
#4  PhpParser\NodeTraverser->traverse() called at [/var/www/html/vendor/vimeo/psalm/src/Psalm/Internal/Scanner/FileScanner.php:86]
#5  Psalm\Internal\Scanner\FileScanner->scan() called at [/var/www/html/vendor/vimeo/psalm/src/Psalm/Internal/Codebase/Scanner.php:558]
#6  Psalm\Internal\Codebase\Scanner->scanFile() called at [/var/www/html/vendor/vimeo/psalm/src/Psalm/Internal/Codebase/Scanner.php:321]
#7  Psalm\Internal\Codebase\Scanner->Psalm\Internal\Codebase\{closure}() called at [/var/www/html/vendor/vimeo/psalm/src/Psalm/Internal/Codebase/Scanner.php:433]
#8  Psalm\Internal\Codebase\Scanner->scanFilePaths() called at [/var/www/html/vendor/vimeo/psalm/src/Psalm/Internal/Codebase/Scanner.php:285]
#9  Psalm\Internal\Codebase\Scanner->scanFiles() called at [/var/www/html/vendor/vimeo/psalm/src/Psalm/Config.php:1992]
#10 Psalm\Config->visitComposerAutoloadFiles() called at [/var/www/html/vendor/vimeo/psalm/src/Psalm/Internal/Analyzer/ProjectAnalyzer.php:398]
#11 Psalm\Internal\Analyzer\ProjectAnalyzer->visitAutoloadFiles() called at [/var/www/html/vendor/vimeo/psalm/src/Psalm/Internal/Analyzer/ProjectAnalyzer.php:578]
#12 Psalm\Internal\Analyzer\ProjectAnalyzer->check() called at [/var/www/html/vendor/vimeo/psalm/src/psalm.php:676]
#13 require_once(/var/www/html/vendor/vimeo/psalm/src/psalm.php) called at [/var/www/html/vendor/vimeo/psalm/psalm:2]
```

As you can see from the backtrace, this happens before analysis. It happens after the deep scanning.

This led me to find another function being mapped incorrectly. This time from a library file. Unfortunately, I can't get it to trigger in a separate repo, so it seems like the bug is related to how files get included?

Is there any way for me to find out what causes a particular file to be scanned?

```
Parsing /var/www/html/vendor/adodb/adodb-php/adodb-xmlschema03.inc.php
Scanning /var/www/html/vendor/adodb/adodb-php/adodb-xmlschema03.inc.php

$function_id = 'fopen';
$storage->cased_name = ' _file_get_contents';
```

issue.title: Fix functions being resolved to other functions

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

issue.body:
Fixes #4750 

Reusing the $function_id variable causes an incorrect global function to be added at line 654

body: I've submitted a PR with a fix. I still don't have a reproducer, though. And no idea of how it would be tested. The method where the change is at is very complex.
